```diff
@@ -1,3 +1,127 @@
  # AIFirst
- # AIFirst
+ 
+ A Next.js application with shadcn/ui, configured for Vercel deployment and Sanity CMS integration.
+ 
+ ## Setup
+ 
+ ### 1. Install Dependencies
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ npm install
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 2. Add v0 Component
+ 
+ Run the following command to add the v0 component:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ npx shadcn@latest add "https://v0.app/chat/b/b_sbp1IYzXvoQ?token=eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJBMjU2R0NNIn0..-hR4wWFFqsq0Z1Z4.iT-NxjMD3zkcE-Xxl3xs3x1BZNx1riv685jXQC9sRb9rumdODGpCGaQlp9s.SvIAPGO8MC19NLx9cL8VJQ"
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Note:** When prompted to overwrite &#96;globals.css&#96;, choose **N** (No) since it's already configured correctly.
+ 
+ ### 3. Configure Environment Variables
+ 
+ Create a &#96;.env.local&#96; file in the root directory:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cp .env.local.example .env.local
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Then update the following variables:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;env
+ NEXT_PUBLIC_SANITY_PROJECT_ID=your_sanity_project_id
+ NEXT_PUBLIC_SANITY_DATASET=production
+ SANITY_API_TOKEN=your_sanity_api_token
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### 4. Sanity Setup
+ 
+ 1. Create a new Sanity project at [sanity.io](https://www.sanity.io)
+ 2. Get your Project ID and Dataset name
+ 3. Create an API token with read/write permissions
+ 4. Add these to your &#96;.env.local&#96; file
+ 
+ ### 5. Development
+ 
+ Run the development server:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ npm run dev
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) in your browser.
+ 
+ ## Deployment
+ 
+ ### Vercel
+ 
+ 1. Push your code to GitHub
+ 2. Import your repository in [Vercel](https://vercel.com)
+ 3. Add environment variables in Vercel dashboard:
+    - &#96;NEXT_PUBLIC_SANITY_PROJECT_ID&#96;
+    - &#96;NEXT_PUBLIC_SANITY_DATASET&#96;
+    - &#96;SANITY_API_TOKEN&#96; (optional, for write operations)
+ 4. Deploy
+ 
+ The project is pre-configured for Vercel with &#96;vercel.json&#96;.
+ 
+ ## Project Structure
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ â”œâ”€â”€ app/              # Next.js app directory
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ globals.css   # Global styles with shadcn/ui theme
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ layout.tsx    # Root layout
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ page.tsx      # Home page
+ â”œâ”€â”€ components/       # React components (shadcn/ui components will be added here)
+ â”œâ”€â”€ lib/              # Utility functions
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ utils.ts      # Utility functions (cn helper)
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ sanity/       # Sanity client and image utilities
+ â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ client.ts # Sanity client configuration
+ â”‚       â””â”€â”€ image.ts  # Image URL builder
+ â”œâ”€â”€ components.json   # shadcn/ui configuration
+ â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.ts # Tailwind CSS configuration
+ â””â”€â”€ next.config.js    # Next.js configuration
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## Features
+ 
+ - âœ… Next.js 14 with App Router
+ - âœ… TypeScript
+ - âœ… shadcn/ui components
+ - âœ… Tailwind CSS with dark mode support
+ - âœ… Sanity CMS integration
+ - âœ… Vercel-ready configuration
+ - âœ… Image optimization for Sanity images
+ 
+ ## Usage
+ 
+ ### Using Sanity Client
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ import { client } from '@/lib/sanity/client'
+ 
+ // Fetch data
+ const data = await client.fetch(&#96;*[_type == "post"]&#96;)
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Using Sanity Images
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ import { urlFor } from '@/lib/sanity/image'
+ import Image from 'next/image'
+ 
+ // In your component
+ &lt;Image
+   src={urlFor(image).width(800).height(600).url()}
+   alt="Description"
+   width={800}
+   height={600}
+ /&gt;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## License
+ 
+ MIT
  
```

Project setup complete. Summary:

## What's been set up:

1. **Next.js 14** with TypeScript and App Router
2. **shadcn/ui** configured with Tailwind CSS and dark mode
3. **Sanity integration** with client and image utilities
4. **Vercel configuration** (`vercel.json`) for deployment
5. **Project structure** with utilities and configuration files

## Next steps:

1. **Install dependencies:**
   ```bash
   npm install
   ```

2. **Add the v0 component:**
   ```bash
   npx shadcn@latest add "https://v0.app/chat/b/b_sbp1IYzXvoQ?token=eyJhbGciOiJkaXIiLCJlbmMiOiJBMjU2R0NNIn0..-hR4wWFFqsq0Z1Z4.iT-NxjMD3zkcE-Xxl3xs3x1BZNx1riv685jXQC9sRb9rumdODGpCGaQlp9s.SvIAPGO8MC19NLx9cL8VJQ"
   ```
   When prompted to overwrite `globals.css`, choose **N** (No) â€” it's already configured.

3. **Set up environment variables:**
   - Copy `.env.local.example` to `.env.local`
   - Add your Sanity project ID, dataset, and API token

The project is ready for Vercel deployment. All configuration files are in place, and the Sanity client is set up to work with Vercel's environment variables.

---


Switched the project to use pnpm. Updates:

1. **vercel.json** â€” Updated to use `pnpm` commands
2. **README.md** â€” All commands now use `pnpm` instead of `npm`
3. **package.json** â€” Added `packageManager` and `engines` fields for pnpm
4. **.gitignore** â€” Added `package-lock.json` and `yarn.lock` to ignore, keeping `pnpm-lock.yaml` (should be committed)
5. **.npmrc** â€” Added pnpm configuration for better peer dependency handling

You can now use:
- `pnpm install` instead of `npm install`
- `pnpm dev` instead of `npm run dev`
- `pnpm dlx shadcn@latest add ...` instead of `npx shadcn@latest add ...`

Vercel will automatically detect and use pnpm based on the `packageManager` field in `package.json`.

---


## Changes Made:

1. **Updated to Next.js 15** â€” Changed from `^14.2.5` to `^15.0.3`
2. **Updated React to 19** â€” Changed from `^18.3.1` to `^19.0.0` (required for Next.js 15)
3. **Fixed Tailwind CSS** â€” Downgraded from `^4.1.18` to `^3.4.17` (Tailwind v4 requires `@tailwindcss/postcss` and has breaking changes; v3 works better with shadcn/ui)
4. **Updated TypeScript types** â€” Updated `@types/react`, `@types/react-dom`, and `@types/node` for React 19 and Next.js 15
5. **Updated TypeScript config** â€” Changed target from `ES2017` to `ES2022` for better compatibility
6. **Updated ESLint config** â€” Changed `eslint-config-next` to `^15.0.0`

The PostCSS config is already correct for Tailwind v3, so no changes were needed there.

Run `pnpm install` to install the updated dependencies. The build should work now. The main fix was downgrading Tailwind from v4 to v3, which is compatible with the current PostCSS setup and shadcn/ui.

---
